intro: Tephrosia leucosericea, commonly known as white silky tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant is notable for its white, silky-hair covered flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Tephrosia leucosericea is also valued for its potential in agroforestry and as a source of medicinal compounds.
